info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 11:52PM PDT until August 21 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 200 AM PDT. * At 1152 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated bands of moderate to heavy rain persisting across southern Clark County. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen over some areas. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are possible flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nelson, Cottonwood Cove, Laughlin FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
